oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Wilson Dam on the Tennessee River
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Stereographic image of an open dam.

Construction of Wilson Dam began in 1918 and was completed in 1924. It was named for President Woodrow Wilson. The Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA) acquired the dam in 1933, and it is one of nine in the TVA system. Its original purpose was to provide hydroelectric power to local nitrate plants and improve navigation of the Tennessee River.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Dams; Dams--Tennessee; Hydroelectric power plants; Wilson, Woodrow, 1856-1924
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Keystone View Company
